abstract.text: This document keeps track of our version history and has all noteworthy changes listed.

inlineContent.text: Runtime crash which might occur in iOS 26 devices when application loads the libraries
are now retrieved internally when calling
Now it is sufficient that the given locking device is provided with
. Replaced by API specific failures (for example
now takes an object conforming to
In order to add option of identifying state changes with locking devices, some breaking changes had to be made to the
This object contains both a hardwareID that can be matched with
This object contains both a hardwareID that can be matched with
now contains firmware version and model type when connecting to unclaimed locking devices
multiple times. Previously, latest subscriber would override
Improved reliability of locking device discovery and disappearing events
because it was relying on a strict regex. It could have been problematic if the
syntax of invitation codes would change later
Make AbloyMobileSDK API protocols public for convenience
waits for lock state to be locked before finishing successfully
waits for lock state to be unlocked before finishing successfully
Deprecation warning for connect without state callbacks
Bug that could cause network request to loop infinitely when a users session expires
less prone to false positive results
Relocated podspec files to root directory.
of integrator will need to be reconfigured with proper paths to the respective podspecs
Added failsafe mechanism to disconnect callback in
. If disconnection is not detected otherwise, it will be triggered after ~25 second inactivity.
Failure state that required app reboot if active session token had expired
for checking if the lock requires certificate update
thrown if lock firmware version is unknown
Lock connection failing sometimes if accesses were refreshed while connected
and other Access refreshing related documentations
Optimized delivery of audit trails by ignoring empty trail requests to backend
for either accepting or rejecting consent
for getting the current consent configuration
for getting an identifier that may be used for correlating logs
Infinite login attempts for deleted accounts
can no longer be called when device is already activated or if
there is a activating/deactivating process ongoing
Bug which was causing multiple lock claims in backend with same serial number
Lock claiming flow to claim locking device first and then do the backend request
Claiming retry functionality if backend claim call fails due to network or any other problem
Race condition with certificate refreshing while accesses were fetched
Bug where lock connecting was taking too long because of a blocking audit trail processing functionality
Bug where lockState subscription was done twice
Bug where audit logs were not sent because of lockState subscription failure
Bug where lock would not be rediscovered on
Incorrect accept headers in network requests
Improved logging and exposed OSLogger debugging
FirmwareUpdateChecking to check if a firmware update is available to be downloaded and installed
New connecting API’s that include a lock state callback
